TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract _ExternalApplication2 implements class Microsoft.Office.Interop.InfoPath.SemiTrust._ExternalApplication

Docs.summary: This type is a wrapper for a COM interface implemented by a coclass that is required by managed code for COM interoperability. To access the members specified by this interface, use the type that wraps the coclass that implements this interface. For information about that type, including usage, remarks, and examples, see.

MemberSignature.Value: public void CacheSolution (string bstrSolutionURI);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CacheSolution(string bstrSolutionURI) cil managed
Public Sub CacheSolution (bstrSolutionURI As String)
public: void CacheSolution(System::String ^ bstrSolutionURI);
abstract member CacheSolution : string -> unit

Docs.param: The string value that specifies the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of the form template. This parameter can be specified as a form definition (.xsf) file or a form template (.xsn) file.
Docs.summary: Examines the form template in the cache and, if necessary, updates it from the published location of the form template.

remarks.para: If the form template that currently exists in the cache matches the form template from the published location, no caching takes place. If the computer is offline and the form is already in the cache, the cache is kept and no update will occur.

Important: This member can be accessed only by forms opened from a form template that has been configured to run with full trust using the Security and Trust category of the Form Options dialog box. This member requires full trust for the immediate caller and cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see "Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code" on MSDN.

example.para: In the following example, which is written in the C# programming language, the CacheSolution method of the object is used to cache an InfoPath form template
Note: The above example assumes that the namespace is being used and that the Microsoft InfoPath 3.0 Type Library is referenced.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Close (string bstrDocumentURI);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Close(string bstrDocumentURI) cil managed
Public Sub Close (bstrDocumentURI As String)
public: void Close(System::String ^ bstrDocumentURI);
abstract member Close : string -> unit

Docs.param: The string value that specifies the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of a form.

remarks.para: The Close method closes the currently open form without quitting the InfoPath application. When using the Close method, the form is closed unconditionally, meaning that any changes made to the data in the form are not saved.

Important: This member can be accessed only by forms opened from a form template that has been configured to run with full trust using the Security and Trust category of the Form Options dialog box. This member requires full trust for the immediate caller and cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see "Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code" on MSDN.

example.para: In the following example, which is written in the C# programming language, the Close method of the object is used to close the currently open form:
Note: The above example assumes that the namespace is being used and that the Microsoft InfoPath 3.0 Type Library is referenced.

MemberSignature.Value: public void New (string bstrDocumentURI, int dwBehavior);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void New(string bstrDocumentURI, int32 dwBehavior) cil managed
Public Sub New (bstrDocumentURI As String, dwBehavior As Integer)
public: void New(System::String ^ bstrDocumentURI, int dwBehavior);
abstract member New : string * int -> unit

Docs.param: The string value that specifies the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of a form.
Default value is 1. Specifies how the form should be opened. The values are based on the enumeration.
Docs.summary: Creates a new form based on a specified form.

remarks.para: The New method can be used to only create a new form based on an existing form; it cannot be used to create a new form based on a form template. To create a form from a form template, use the method.
When you use the New method, InfoPath is opened and the new form is ready to be filled out.
Note You cannot use to close a form that has been opened with the New method. When the New method creates a form, the name of that form is not yet known.

Important: This member can be accessed only by forms opened from a form template that has been configured to run with full trust using the Security and Trust category of the Form Options dialog box. This member requires full trust for the immediate caller and cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see "Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code" on MSDN.

example.para: In the following example, which is written in the C# programming language, the New method of the object is used to create a new form based on a specified form:
Note: The above example assumes that the namespace is being used and that the Microsoft InfoPath 3.0 Type Library is referenced.

Docs.param: The string value that specifies the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of a form template.
Docs.summary: Creates a new form based on the specified form template.

remarks.para: The NewFromSolution method can be used only to create a new form based on an existing form template; it cannot be used to create a new form based on an existing form. To create a form from an existing form, use .
When you use The NewFromSolution method, InfoPath is opened and the new form is ready to be filled out.
Note: You cannot use to close a form that has been opened with the NewFromSolution method. When the NewFromSolution method creates a form, the name of that form is not yet known.

Important: This member can be accessed only by forms opened from a form template that has been configured to run with full trust using the Security and Trust category of the Form Options dialog box. This member requires full trust for the immediate caller and cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see "Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code" on MSDN.

Note: The above example assumes that the namespace is being used and that the Microsoft InfoPath 3.0 Type Library is referenced.

MemberSignature.Value: public void NewFromSolutionWithInputParameters (string bstrSolutionURI, string bstrInputParameters);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void NewFromSolutionWithInputParameters(string bstrSolutionURI, string bstrInputParameters) cil managed
Public Sub NewFromSolutionWithInputParameters (bstrSolutionURI As String, bstrInputParameters As String)

abstract member NewFromSolutionWithInputParameters : string * string -> unit

Docs.param: The Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of the form template on which to base the new form.
One or more name/value pairs separated by the ampersand (&) character.
Docs.summary: Creates a new form using the specified form template with the specified form template and input parameters.

remarks.para: To use the input parameters passed to the parameter, the form specified in the parameter must contain a event handler that uses the property of the class to retrieve the input parameter values, and then do something with those values. For an example of how to do this, see the property topic.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Open (string bstrDocumentURI, int dwBehavior);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Open(string bstrDocumentURI, int32 dwBehavior) cil managed
Public Sub Open (bstrDocumentURI As String, dwBehavior As Integer)
public: void Open(System::String ^ bstrDocumentURI, int dwBehavior);
abstract member Open : string * int -> unit

Docs.param: The string value that specifies the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of a form.
Default value is 1. Specifies how the form should be opened. The values are based on the enumeration.

remarks.para: The Open method can be used only to open a form; it cannot be used to open a form template. To create a form from a form template, use the method. To create a form based on an existing form, use the method.

Important: This member can be accessed only by forms opened from a form template that has been configured to run with full trust using the Security and Trust category of the Form Options dialog box. This member requires full trust for the immediate caller and cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see "Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code" on MSDN.

example.para: In the following example, which is written in the C# programming language, the Open method of the object is used to open a form from the file system:
Note: The above example assumes that the namespace is being used and that the Microsoft InfoPath 3.0 Type Library is referenced.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Quit ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Quit() cil managed
Public Sub Quit ()
public: void Quit();
abstract member Quit : unit -> unit

remarks.para: If you use the method before using the Quit method, data that has been changed in the form will not be saved, nor will users be prompted to save it. However, if you do not use the Close method but only use the Quit method, users will be prompted to save the form before quitting the InfoPath application.

Important: This member can be accessed only by forms opened from a form template that has been configured to run with full trust using the Security and Trust category of the Form Options dialog box. This member requires full trust for the immediate caller and cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see "Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code" on MSDN.

example.para: In the following example, which is written in the C# programming language, the Quit method of the object is used to close InfoPath:
Note: The above example assumes that the namespace is being used and that the Microsoft InfoPath 3.0 Type Library is referenced.

MemberSignature.Value: public void RegisterSolution (string bstrSolutionURL, string bstrBehavior);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void RegisterSolution(string bstrSolutionURL, string bstrBehavior) cil managed
Public Sub RegisterSolution (bstrSolutionURL As String, bstrBehavior As String)
public: void RegisterSolution(System::String ^ bstrSolutionURL, System::String ^ bstrBehavior);
abstract member RegisterSolution : string * string -> unit

Docs.param: Specifies the Uniform Resource Locator (URL) of the form template. This parameter can be specified as a form definition (.xsf) file or a form template (.xsn) file.
Default value is overwrite. Specifies how the form template is to be installed. The only other valid value for this parameter is new-only.

remarks.para: If the form template has already been registered, and the new-only value is used for the parameter, the RegisterSolution method will return an error. If the overwrite value is used, the form template's registration record will be overwritten.

Important: This member can be accessed only by forms opened from a form template that has been configured to run with full trust using the Security and Trust category of the Form Options dialog box. This member requires full trust for the immediate caller and cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see "Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code" on MSDN.

example.para: In the following example, which is written in the C# programming language, the RegisterSolution method of the object is used to install a form template:
Note: The above example assumes that the namespace is being used and that the Microsoft InfoPath 3.0 Type Library is referenced.

public: void UnregisterSolution(System::String ^ bstrSolutionURI);
abstract member UnregisterSolution : string -> unit

Docs.param: The string value that specifies the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of the form template.

remarks.para: If the form template cannot be unregistered, the UnregisterSolution method will return an error.

Important: This member can be accessed only by forms opened from a form template that has been configured to run with full trust using the Security and Trust category of the Form Options dialog box. This member requires full trust for the immediate caller and cannot be used by partially trusted code. For more information, see "Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code" on MSDN.
